manify.embedders.coordinate_learning

Implementation for coordinate training and optimization

Functions

train_coords(pm, dists[, test_indices, ...])

Coordinate training and optimization
manify.embedders.coordinate_learning.train_coords(pm, dists, test_indices=tensor([]), device='cpu', burn_in_learning_rate=0.001, burn_in_iterations=2000, learning_rate=0.01, scale_factor_learning_rate=0.0, training_iterations=18000, loss_window_size=100, logging_interval=10)

Coordinate training and optimization

Parameters:

  • pm (ProductManifold) – ProductManifold object that encapsulates the manifold and its signature.

  • dists (Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_points']) – (n_points, n_points) Tensor representing the pairwise distance matrix between points.

  • test_indices (Int[Tensor, 'n_test']) – (n_test) Tensor representing the indices of the test points.

  • device (str) – Device for training (default: “cpu”).

  • burn_in_learning_rate (float) – Learning rate during the burn-in phase (default: 1e-3).

  • burn_in_iterations (int) – Number of iterations during the burn-in phase (default: 2,000).

  • learning_rate (float) – Learning rate during the training phase (default: 1e-2).

  • scale_factor_learning_rate (float) – Learning rate for scale factor optimization (default: 0.0).

  • training_iterations (int) – Number of iterations for the training phase (default: 18,000).

  • loss_window_size (int) – Window size for computing the moving average of the loss (default: 100).

  • logging_interval (int) – Interval for logging the training progress (default: 10).

Returns:

Tensor of the final learned coordinates in the manifold. losses: List of loss values at each iteration during training.

Return type:

pm.x_embed
